points.name: Glies
points.desc:
A continent to the east of Kalkatesh on the planet Verum. It's based on different asian cultures and is the main continent for the Phase 4 of Verum games.

It is home to several native races that live organized in feudal states and clans separated into four groupings: the Northern Kingdoms, the Southern Kingdoms, the Western Kingdoms, and the Eclipse.

categories.title: History
categories.info:
Some years before the Battle in the Sky, the Great Calamity of the Violet, a group of adventurers crossed the Abyssal Sea from Kalkatesh as part of the First Glies Expedition. Among those in the group were Alexander, a righteous paladin; and Lord Azolon, a powerful wizard from Kalkatesh's Mages Guild.

During the Expedition they founded the western port city of Alexandria, named for Alexander after he died to the Stranger. The city is currently governed by Lord Azolon, who serves as the Archmage of the Mages Guild he established in Glies.

In the 50 years after the Calamity, Glies experienced two important historical events. The first one is the strange behavior of the Mists, a strange and dangerous phenomena that used to be limited to the surrounding environment of the Titan’s Eye, with its movement Westward. The second is the unification of the Eastern Kingdoms into the Eclipse, by warlord Otami Kurosai.

categories.title: Technology
categories.info:
Glies is one tech level below Kalkatesh, that means it doesn't have access to Alchemical Engines nor Renaissance-style technology.

Even though Kalkateshian Airships are not common to Glies, the winds in Glies are so reliable that the main method of transportation is by Kite, both for personal use and for the creation of complete establishments sustained by Kites.

Even with the lower technological level, Glies applies magic and relies on the Yokai for most of the comforts associated with higher levels. For example, even with a lack of electricity, cities and villages can be illuminated at night using magical means.

categories.title: Religion
categories.info: Glien religion is more polytheistic and nature-oriented than Kalkatesh. In Glies, spirituality revolves around the Yokai, spirits that wander the land as any other mortal would. Dragons also exist in Glies, but are more spiritual and serpent-like.

categories.title: Yokai
categories.info:
Yokai are the spirits of Glies. They are spiritual representations of natural laws and forces.

There are several different types of Yokai, and only the most important/powerful ones can ascend to the rank of Kami.

categories.title: Akuma
categories.info: The Akuma are the corrupted Yokai found on Glies. They are essentially the same as the demons from the West. Akuma naturally form from the negative emotions of mortal-kind.

categories.title: Tribes, Clans & Races
categories.info:
Even though it was disclosed that some Races have a specific homeland, like Geckoi with the Laughing Swamp, and there still are what it seem as Geckoi-only tribes, it's also important to highlight the fact that Northern and Southern Clans are not Race-based.

Even though any Race can be part of any Clan, there seem to still exist some smaller tribes of specific Races dispersed without complete or full clan affiliation. It is not clear at this point if one political structure preceded the other, or the relationship between both forms of social organization.

categories.title: Elves
categories.info: Elves in Glies are more attuned with nature than their Kalkateshian equivalents, to the point of having their skin infused with different types of wood. There are three types of Glien elves: Whitewood, Greenwood and Reedwood.

categories.title: Geckoi
categories.info: The Geckoi are an androgynous race of lizard-looking people. Males have spikes on their backs and tails, while females have feathers. They tend to favor the life of merchants and their relationship culture is polygamous.

categories.title: Tearn
categories.info:
The Tearn are a race of people with bat characteristics, including bat-like ears and wings attached to their arms. Even though the wings don’t provide a reliable way of flying, they can take advantage of the reliable winds of Glies to do so, even if they lack a kite.

Tearn value intelligence highly.

categories.title: Yozai
categories.info: The Yozai are the offspring of a mortal and a Yokai. The Yozai are always half-human and half-yokai, independently of the race of the mortal parent. They also have spectral arms that reflect characteristics of their Yokai parent.

categories.title: Ho'ask
categories.info:
The Ho’ask are a race of people with marked yak-styled characteristics, including distinctive horns, ears, and a bulky build. The general treatment, adorning, and even cutting, of the horns has a prominent place in their culture.

Lying is also considered a mortal sin in their culture. Ho'ask represent about 20% of the Glien population.

points.name: The Flowing Lands
points.desc: Fertile lands marked by terrains of various elevations, with several rivers, waterfalls, and villages dispersed in it.

categories.title: History
categories.info:
It is said that the flowing lands were created by the Father of the Yozai. When the mortal Mother of the Yozai died of old age, he became consumed by grief and transformed into an Akuma.

Rather then lash out at others, he instead became consumed by sadness and let his tears flow out endlessly. His tears formed the lakes and rivers of the Flowing Lands causing much destruction until he was killed by the first Onimetsu.

points.name: Alexandria
points.desc:
A city in the Flowing Lands of the continent of Glies. It is a port city on the western side of the continent which was founded by immigrants from Kalkatesh who sailed to Glies as part of the First Glies Expedition. The city is a memoriam to Alexander Glenn, a cocksure Aasimar Paladin who was killed during the immigrants' expedition.

This is the only place within Glies where Kalkateshians have been allowed to colonize.

The only time Kalkateshians are able to travel to Glies is during the Festival of the Seven, when the leviathans in the abyssal ocean sleep.

points.name: The Maw
points.desc: Is where many those who seek the sailing life operate in rivers and in the sea itself. The islands islands surrounding this sea resemble teeth.

points.name: Greenbramble
points.desc:
Greenbramble is a geckoi village located in a forest on Glies. The villages is built within the tall trees of the forest as the geckoi can easily climb.

It is normally protected by the Yokai baboon Whitefury.

points.name: Uzu
points.desc:
Uzu is one of the many small villages that dot the Flowing Lands, it is located on the border of the Wailing Sears.

The village is home to a nearby shrine which appears to have had its former occupants mysteriously massacred.

points.name: Okogi
points.desc: Okogi is a village located in the Flowing Lands of Glies. It has an abandoned fortress near it leftover from the last clashing of the clans of the Northern Kingdoms.

points.name: Wailing Scars
points.desc:
An enormous bamboo shoot forest.

Prized for the privacy it can offer, entire estates can be hidden among its maze-like reeds from those who travel on the roads. It’s also the most western region where the Mists have been seen by adventurers.

points.name: Laughing Swamp
points.desc:
A swamp region that contains various herbs, fungus, fruits and other flora with special and medicinal qualities.

The water is relatively shallow, reaching up to 6-feet deep. The trees are of considerable height, with straight trunks and a tangle of roots that are visible outside of the soil.

It is the homeland of the Geckoi and their capital of Black Hollow is in the north.

points.name: Black Hollow
points.desc: Capital city of the Geckoi, as the Geckoi generally don't like staying in one place for too long, Black Hollow is akin to an enormous inn.

points.name: Wandering Weal
points.desc: A large open field that is the homeland of the Ho'ask and their capital city of Haven Rock.

points.name: Haven Rock
points.desc: Capital city of the Ho'ask.

points.name: The Titan’s Eye
points.desc:
Appears as a big lake surrounded by mountain ranges.

Historically the mountain ranges are said to contain the dangerous Mists found in western Glies, with traders and travelers having been able to avoid it by virtue of its seasonal qualities.

However, in the 50 years leading to the beginning of Phase 4 the Mists have become more prevalent, reaching far into the west, effectively cutting the Western section of Glies from the more Eastern section.

points.name: Kuzu
points.desc: A small village on the eastern border of the Titan's Eye.

points.name: Northern Province
points.desc:
The north is characterized by the prevalence of Yokai, making the people living in the northern clans more spiritual, accepting, and less xenophobic. The north is also characterized by its temperature, which gets lower further to the north, and by its mountainous terrain.

Within the northern province reside the northern kingdoms which are more directly connected with the Yokai that rule them and are very spiritual.

points.name: Northern Kingdoms
points.desc: Within the northern province reside the northern kingdoms which are more directly connected with the Yokai that rule them and are very spiritual. They are separated into clans representing different elements: fire, water, wind, wood, metal, light, shadow, and blood.

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Fire & Steel: +3 to all fire damage sources, if from a weapon +6.

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Icy Veins: Immunity to non-magical cold damage and resistance to magical cold damage.

categories.title: Ethics & Beliefs
categories.info:
Don't use bladed weapons

Avoid killing if possible

Believe in Joy & Meditation

Most open to incorporating new members and letting them leave

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Above the Clouds: Proficiency with battle kites.

categories.title: Symbol
categories.info: 3 white trees in tri cross pattern

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Fleetest of Foot: +15 to base movement speed.

categories.title: Ethics & Beliefs
categories.info: It is common custom to keep the first "coin earned" as a memento

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Gold Standard: Increase wealth rewards by 20% from completed missions.

points.name:
Yang Clan
(阳 / 陽 or 光)

categories.title: Ethics & Beliefs
categories.info: Beauty as a measure of a person's value

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Serene Beauty: You may use Charisma as your ability modifier when making a weapon attack.

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: In The Shadow: While in darkness, advantages on stealth check and ignore disadvantage on stealth checks from wearing armor.

categories.title: Ethics & Beliefs
categories.info: Uses blood of enemies to paint themselves

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Blood In The Water: Heal character level in hitpoints whenever you kill a worth opponent in combat.

points.name: Southern Province
points.desc: Within the southern province reside the southern kingdoms whose leaders are based off real-world leaders from Asia.

points.name: Southern Kingdoms
points.desc: Southern Kingdoms are known for their political focus and military might, with much less spirituality and Yokai presence.

categories.title: Ethics & Beliefs
categories.info: Winning a battle before fighting it

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Supreme Excellence: You may use Intelligence as your ability modifier when making a weapon attack.

categories.title: Ethics & Beliefs
categories.info: Avoid the need for war in the first place. Far more accepting of individuality and personal rights than other clans

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Reformation and Poise: Advantage on Persuasion against hostile creatures. +2 AC against all creatures that share an initiative if used in combat.

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Tireless Cunning: When successfully deceiving a creature, detect it's next attempt at deceiving you and gain 2d6 untyped damage against it.

categories.title: Symbol
categories.info: Mustard, Dark Red and Black colors.

categories.title: Ethics & Beliefs
categories.info:
Ideals of Meritocracy

A capable individual can come from any place

Heavy use of Basket Helmets, symbol of equality

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: From Any Place: Stacking bonus on successful attack roll/saving throw, resets on fail.

categories.title: Symbol
categories.info: Open Helping Hand. Dark Yellow and Green colors.

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Peace Endures: Can use non-lethal damage with any source. Regain level hitpoints when non-lethally defeats an opponent.

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: In The Dragon's Eye: Immune to death effects and resistant to necrotic damage.

categories.title: Symbol
categories.info:
Mask / Scroll and Spyglass crossed

Colors White & Blue

categories.title: Ethics & Beliefs
categories.info: Wear masks to hide the deception of the personal Charisma, focus on "objective" truths.

categories.title: Main Activity
categories.info:
Scientific Advancement, the most technologically advanced clan in Glies, closer to Kalkatesh

Able to create Full Plate Mail armor.

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Thirst for Knowledge: Any 2 skills proficiency, Expertise in one proficient skill.

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: The Haka: When initiative is rolled, may use battle cry with save DC (10+level) to frighten enemies for 1 minute, they damage you, or you are defeated.

categories.title: Symbol
categories.info: A Fish Head and a Hook

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Well Salted: Swim 30 ft, hold breath 4x longer than normal. No disadvantage when fighting in water or unbalanced terrain.

categories.title: Unique Trait
categories.info: Thorned Flower: When attacking with melee weapon or ranged weapon within 30ft, one ally adjacent to the target can spend his reaction to attack that target. Can be used up to proficiency times per short rest.

points.name: Path of Prosperity
points.desc:
An enormous network of roads and paths that contorts itself like a serpent between the Northern and Southern Kingdoms of Glies. It is the trade route that connects the west to the east.

In the past the various clans have fought over it yet the Path of Prosperity has remained without a ruler.

points.name: Shol'Heer
points.desc: An enormous free city regarded as the home of the Yozai.

points.name: Bal'Lok
points.desc: Capital city of the Tearn.

points.name: Chimeveld
points.desc:
Chimeveld is a small village near Bal'Lok. It is often described as a sleepy traveler's town. Most of the gold/jade generated in this town comes from travelers looking for lodging, food, and information while on their way to the city.

Recently a wave of nightmares hit the villagers overnight, causing many of them to act aggressively and attack anything on sight. As a result, Chimeveld is now burning and cursed.

points.name: Boof n' Brew
points.desc:
Homestead of the Divine Wind.

This is where The Divine Wind group has settled down to raise the ho'ask child destined to be the next emperor of Glies.

points.name: Uyo
points.desc: Uyo is a small village along the Path of Prosperity near where a group of adventurers settled down to raise the infant Divine Emperor.

points.name: Dozo
points.desc:
A small village led by the Dozo family located along the Path of Prosperity.

Recently young women have been going missing in this area, rumors say that the local Daimyo is involved.

points.name: Seat of the Elements
points.desc: This is where the Kami, the greatest of the Yokai, manifest themselves in the mortal realm.

points.name: The Crashing Coast
points.desc: An area in the center-north-east that is constantly berated by storms.

points.name: Joka Vall
points.desc: A city built atop the ruins of the former capital of a race known as the Ominax. An adventuring hub where people go to seek artifacts in the thousands of ruins there.

points.name: Eclipse
points.desc:
Formerly known as the Eastern Kingdoms, is now the country and geographical region that resulted from the unification of the eastern kingdoms by the warlord Otami Kurosai.

It is believed that the name of "Eclipse" signifies many different things. Some believe it is the eclipsing of the sun from Glies as the warriors of the night take their hold. Some believe it is simply a reference to a woman that was once loved by the Pale Emperor. Nobody really knows. There are many many stories as to what the name is.

 As of recently it appears as if the Eclipse wants to expand further into the rest of Glies.

points.name: Da-Shi-Shi
points.desc: The city where the imperial throne resides.

points.name: Depthar Outbreak
points.desc:
In an effort to save Dik'Cok from his captors, Eli Bloodbane and Machio Manis devised a plan to summon the favor of Crowley to aid with the rescue. After piling up corpses from a ruined village they were in, they created a shrine of corpses and blood.

Through their actions they inadvertently provided Crowley with enough divine sway in Glies to start a Dephtar infection event, infecting the Black Silver bandits raiding the village, turning them into fleshcrimes.
